SENT.plain: A 45-year-old patient presented with bilateral orbital abscesses
He was found to have Lemierre syndrome, a condition involving septic thrombophlebitis of the internal jugular vein
The patient developed severe proptosis, sepsis, and cavernous sinus thrombosis
Despite aggressive antibiotic and anticoagulation therapy, visual loss was rapid, and the patient ultimately died
Lemierre syndrome, previously thought to be rare, is now becoming more commonly reported
Its prompt diagnosis and treatment are essential for patient survival
